titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Gaston Bergery papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-06-30T10:29-0700

change.item: Updated to reflect that envelope of photos is in the oversize photo file and that the location of broadsides and posters is currently unknown (Sarah Patton).
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Gaston Bergery Papers)//EN" "bergeryg.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, telegrams, reports, memoranda, lists, speeches and writings, and leaflets relating to French political events and foreign relations, France during World War II, and the Front Populaire.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gaston Bergery papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1977.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Paris, France
Received bachelor's degree in law
Enlisted; wounded in 1915
Liaison with the British Army
Decorated with the Military Cross for distinguished services
Attached to the Secretariat of the Versailles Peace Conference
Deputy Secretary-General of the Inter-Allied Commission for Reparations
Married Germaine Malançon
Decorated with the Legion of Honor
Delegate to the London Conference
Director of the Cabinet of Edouard Herriot, Minister of Foreign Affairs
In charge of a mission to the United States
Attorney, Court of Appeals, Paris (specialized in private international law)
Married Lubov Krassin; son Jean-François raised by her in London after she and Bergery divorced in 1928
Founded the daily Mantes Republicain
Deputy of the Seine-et-Oise (radical-socialist party); Member, Committee on Foreign Affairs
Founded and directed the weekly La Flèche
Deputy ( frontiste party, which he founded with Jacques Izard)
Married Elisabeth (Bettina) Shaw-Jones
Author, Air-Afrique, Voie Impériale
Author, Notre Plan, Principes de l'Economie Frontiste
Sent on a mission to Switzerland by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Ambassador to the Soviet Union
Ambassador to Turkey
Returned voluntarily to France; Tried, Court of Justice, Paris - Acquitted in 1949
Resumed legal career
Author, La Vierge et le Sagittaire (under the pseudonym of Gaston François)
Columnist for the daily Paris-Presse l'Intransigeant ( Libre Chronique Diplomatique)
Retired
Died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, telegrams, reports, memoranda, lists, speeches and writings, and leaflets relating to French political events and foreign relations, France during World War II, and the Front Populaire.

controlaccess.corpname: Inter-allied Conference on Reparations and Inter-allied Debts (1924 : London, England).
controlaccess.subject: Communism--France.
Elections--France.
World War, 1914-1918--Reparations.
World War, 1939-1945--France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, legal documents pertaining to Bergery's trial, and membership cards, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Dedications to Bergery by friends of his, written on the title pages of their books

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Barbusse, Henri [See SUBJECT FILE, Comité Mondial de Lutte Contre la Guerre Impérialiste and Comité National de Lutte Contre la Guerre et le Fascisme]
Guitard, Louis [See SPFECHES AND WRITINGS, Radio Broadcast]
Guyon, Robert [See also Temps de Paris and Tixier-Vignancourt, Jean-Louis],
Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace, Stanford,
Jouvenel, Bertrand de [See also SUBJECT FILE, France, Foreign Relations, Italy],
Moulin de la Barthète, H. du,
Noailles, Vicomte Charles de et Marie-Laure,
Paris-Presse L'Intransigeant, Paris [See also Corre, Max],
Pomereu, Marquise Lydie de (born de Mun),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, diaries, books, declarations, editorials, essays, poetry, speeches, arranged alphabetically by title.

See also CORRESPONDENCE, Pétain, Maréchal; SUBJECT FILE, Ambassadorships of Bergery, Turkey; Chamber of Deputies; Conseil National; L'Europe Nouvelle; French Mission; League of Nations; Mission to America; Reparations, Inter-Allied Commission for.

did.unittitle: List of people to whom to send articles
"Aux Français de Bonne Volonté" (To Frenchmen of good will) - typewritten copy of a political appeal,
"Conte pour le 21 Mars" (Tale for the 21st of March) - handwritten copy,
"Déclaration sur l'Assemblée Nationale" (Declaration on the National Assembly) - typewritten carbon copy and printed copy,
"Effets de Neige" (Snow effects) - printed copy of an essay, published in Primavera, Paris,
"Français!" (Frenchmen!) - typewritten carbon copy of a political appeal,
Interviews - typewritten carbon copies and printed copies
"Lettre" (Letter) - typewritten carbon copy of a political appeal,
"Libre Chronique Diplomatique" (Free diplomatic chronicle) - typewritten carbon copies and printed copies of daily columns published in Paris-Presse L'Intransigeant, Paris,
Literary criticism - handwritten and typewritten notes
"Le Mal Français" (The French disease) - typewritten copy of a political appeal,
"Note sur la Politique en Afrique du Nord" (Note on politics in North Africa) - typewritten carbon copy of an analysis intended for Marechal Petain,
"Le Pays Mantais" (The "Mantais" country) - typewritten carbon copy of a speech, and printed excerpts published in L'Echo des Touristes, Paris,

Radio broadcast on "Europe No.1" - typewritten transcripts of a talk given by Bergery on the fall of France in June 1940, the Vichy government, the Resistance, etc. and of the interview which followed,
"Ski 1946. Essai sur le Matériel, la Technique et l'Enseignement" (Ski 1946. Essay on the equipment, the technique and the instruction) - handwritten and typewritten copies of a manuscript,
"Soir d'Hiver" (Winter evening) - printed copy of an essay published in Primavera, Paris,
La Vierge et le Sagittaire (The virgin and the archer), Paris - handwritten draft, including sketches
La Vierge et le Sagittaire (The virgin and the archer), Paris - printed copy,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conference proceedings, correspondence, election material, financial studies, memoranda, printed matter, and reports, arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Briefs and other legal documents, and correspondence, arranged alphabetically by case title, usually the name of Bergery's client.

did.unittitle: Mer Morte, sels de brome dans la

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings mentioning Bergery or directly related to his career, arranged chronologically. See also BIOGRAPHICAL FILE, Trial.

did.unittitle: Articles in which Bergery was misrepresented and for which he sent rebuttals to the respective newspapers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 27 prints depicting Bergery and others (including one of him and Stavisky as children, posing for a grade school class picture); scenes of Chad and the French Alps; a 1931 civilian airplane; sketches of Bergery and of the Chamber of Deputies; 1 postcard of the Berlin Wall.
